Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe (#1) -- Prop.#1 - 2.50 Mills - City Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1
(Civic Center Complex - Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 2.50 mills property tax renewal for the purpose of paying a part of the cost of operating and maintaining the Monroe Civic Center Complex.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew a special tax of two and fifty one-hundredths (2.50) mills on the dollar on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $930,793.89 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of paying a part of the cost of operating and maintaining the Monroe Civic Center Complex, including the cost of repairs, improvements and additions thereto, said tax being a renewal of an existing tax which will expire in 2008?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe (#2) -- Prop.#2 - 2.50 Mills - City Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2
(Zoo - Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 2.50 mills property tax renewal for the purpose of paying a part of the cost of operating and maintaining the Louisiana Purchase Gardens and Zoo.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew a special tax of two and fifty one-hundredths (2.50) mills on the dollar on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $930,793.89 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of paying a part of the cost of operating and maintaining the Louisiana Purchase Gardens and Zoo, including the cost of repairs, improvements and additions thereto, said tax being a renewal of an existing tax which will expire in 2008?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe (#3) -- Prop.#3 - 3.25 Mills - City Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 3
(Capital Improvements - Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 3.25 mills property tax renewal for the purpose of paying a part of capital improvements.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew a special tax of three and twenty-five one-hundredths (3.25) mills on the dollar on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $1,210,032.06 reasonably expected at this time to be
collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of making capital improvements, including providing matching funds for federal, state or other grants for such capital improvements said tax being a renewal of an existing tax which will expire in 2008?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe (#4) -- Prop.#4 - 1.50 Mills - City Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 4
(Police Department - Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 1.50 mills property tax renewal for the purpose of paying a part of
providing additional support to the Monroe City Police Department.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew a special tax of one and fifty one-hundredths (1.50) mills on the dollar on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $558,476.33 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of providing additional support to the Monroe City Police Department, including the acquisition of equipment and vehicles, said tax being a renewal of an existing tax which will expire in 2008?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe (#5) -- Prop.#5 - 1.50 Mills - City Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 5
(Fire Department - Renewal)

Summary: 10 year, 1.50 mills property tax renewal for the purpose of paying a part of
providing additional support to the Monroe City Fire Department.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew a special tax of one and fifty one-hundredths (1.50) mills on the dollar on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $558,476.33 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of providing additional support to the Monroe City Fire Department, including the acquisition of equipment and vehicles, said tax being a renewal of an existing tax which will expire in 2008?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Monroe (#6) -- Prop.#6 - 1.00 Mills - City Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Propostion No. 6
(Airport - New)

Summary: 10 year, 1.00 mill new property tax for the purpose of paying for construction or enhancements of the Monroe Regional Airport.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Monroe, State of Louisiana (the "City"), levy a special tax of one and no one-hundredths (1.00) mills on the dollar on all property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $372,317.56 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of construction or enhancements of the Monroe Regional Airport and its facilities including providing matching funds for federal, state or other grants for such purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Richwood -- 20 Mills - Mayor & BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Richwood Tax Proposition
(Police Department and Recreation Tax)

Summary:  10 year property tax for the purpose of maintaining the police department and operating the recreation facility of the Town.
Race.FullText:
Shall the Town of Richwood, Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), levy a twenty mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said Town for a period of
ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending in the year 2018, for the purpose of maintaining the police department and operating the recreation facilities in the Town?  It is estimated (as of the date of this proposition) that the amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the first year will be approximately $79,260.64.
